title: Syria's government reaches agreement with Kurds of Rojava
subhed: A ceasefire has been established after three weeks of fighting. The Kurds have secured major gains in local autonomy and national rights, while the Syrian president claims to have restored national unity.
byline: By Hélène Sallon (Damascus, Syria, special correspondent)

title: Who's running in the Paris mayoral election?
byline: By Manon Romain and Hélène Bekmezian

title: Gaza civil defense says 22 killed in Israeli strikes
France tightens infant formula rules after toxin scare
subhed: Potentially contaminated products were recalled over 60 countries by Nestlé, Danone, and Lactalis after it was revealed some batches could be contaminated with cereulide.

title: Appeals trial for murder of teacher Samuel Paty focuses on defendants' personal lives
subhed: The first week of hearings at the Special Criminal Court exposed the contradictions of the defendants Brahim Chnina and Abdelhakim Sefrioui. They were found guilty of participation in a terrorist criminal conspiracy for the 2020 killing.

title: Catherine O'Hara, iconic comedy figure, dies age 71
subhed: Known for her roles in 'Beetlejuice' and 'Home Alone' on the big screen, and more recently in the series 'Schitt's Creek,' the Canadian-American actress died on Friday, January 30, in Los Angeles following an illness.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'
subhed: To win the cultural and intellectual battle, Europe must staunchly defend its model, writes the economist in his column, dismantling the narrative of a 'declining' continent.

title: Venezuela's interim president announces mass amnesty law
US Senate passes deal expected to shorten shutdown
Social media ban for under-15s: Why everyone in France will soon have to verify their age
byline: By Damien Leloup and Florian Reynaud

title: US approves multibillion-dollar arms sales to both Israel and Saudi Arabia
In Svalbard, where sea ice is vanishing faster than anywhere else, polar bears remain healthy
Switzerland's ill-prepared army faces new global disorder
US Justice Department releases over 3 million more pages of Epstein files
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Thousands rally in Minneapolis' freezing temperatures as anti-ICE anger continues to escalate
Pieter Mulier leaves Maison Alaïa
Beehives, yachts and cattle: How France manages 'atypical' seized assets
Nestlé knew of toxins in baby formula 10 days before first recalls
byline: By Mathilde Gérard and Laurence Girard

title: Paris reaches the pinnacle of haute couture
byline: By Elvire von Bardeleben and Valentin Pérez

title: 'Facing Trump, Europe, Canada and Latin America have to navigate between misalignment, non-alignment and avoidance'
subhed: The sweeping powers that the US president has granted himself through his Board of Peace serve only to discourage even the best intentions, observes Le Monde's columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Yuri Dmitriev, the Russian historian imprisoned for denouncing Kremlin attempts to rewrite history
subhed: Detained in a penal colony in Mordovia, the 70-year-old historian, who specializes in the Stalin regime's crimes, is one of Russia's oldest political prisoners. His crime? Refusing to accept historical falsifications that the Kremlin aims to impose on public opinion.

title: 'The only thing left to do is leave': Cuba pushed to the brink
subhed: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (2/3). Since the wave of unrest that swept the country in 2021, more than two million Cubans have fled. Those who remain on the island scrape by with varying degrees of success, as the exorbitant price of basic goods has become a source of inequality between those with nothing and those with access to foreign currency.

title: Environment: Europe's temptation to unravel hard-won progress, ignoring scientific truth
The duty of solidarity with the Iranian people
France's under-15 social media ban: 'Parents are being asked to do the dirty work that the government has refused to impose'
